channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Toilets filthy with excrement in most and one totally blocked, 9th July
item.description:
I visited these toilets today about 12 o’clock and was shocked and disgusted. They have recently been renovated. However, most toilets were covered in excrement, one was blocked and hardly any had toilet paper. Whoever is supposed to be cleaning these is not doing their job properly. As it is nearly the summer holidays when they will be used more, cleaning is urgent and should surely be ongoing. It really gives bexley a bad name.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Danson Park, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is leaning and lifting pavement and cement adjoining driveway, 9th July
item.description:
This tree has numerous issues. It is no longer growing properly - there are very few leaves at the end of the new branches. Low hanging branches touch vehicles and pedestrians. The tree has started leaning towards the road and you can see in one photo that this now affects vehicles parking. Also, it is now lifting the pavement and I have witnessed many people tripping over this as it’s hard to see. Lastly, the cement is lifting where the tree root is coming under my drive and is likely to start making that worse and lifting my drive before long.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 109, Marlow Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous junction for pedestrians, 9th July
item.description:
This junction has no pedestrian crossing on its north side. It does not have easy indication for pedestrians on its north side crossing. There is no green/red man. It does not even appear to be a junction to an average pedestrian without full attention. Pedestrians frequently do not realise that the southbound road from valegro house is has a green light for vehicles.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 129, Greenwich High Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple Piles of Rubbish with Flies, 9th July
item.description:
Rubbish from both Pepe’s and the new Pharmacy piling up again. Bags are ripped with flies all round them. Floor / gutter has remanence of old food and oil that hasn’t been cleaned up - they should take note of the Thai Tiger who hoses and cleans the pavement outside their premises regularly. This had been a continuous problem which is getting worst now we’re in the summer heat. Residence are not allowed to just dump rubbish bags outside to be collected so I’m not sure why businesses are allowed to - especially when it’s food waste.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Woolwich Road, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Neighbour Flat 28 Cherbury Court, N1 6TL, 9th July
item.description:
Anti-Social Behaviour! They live above us. Randomly banging for long periods of time maliciously. You can tell it wasn't any DIY taking place. Spraying excessively bleach based products via all the Windows of the flat, so it enters our property - inhaling.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): St Johns Estate, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
